abstract: Texas Court of Criminal Appeals stays scheduled execution of Rodney Reed, who was convicted of killing a 19-year-old woman in 1996; is reviewing claims of erroneous evidence.
lead_paragraph: The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals on Monday stayed the scheduled March 5 execution of Rodney Reed, who was convicted of killing a 19-year-old woman in 1996.
snippet: The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals on Monday stayed the scheduled March 5 execution of Rodney Reed, who was convicted of killing a 19-year-old woman in 1996.
